title: Failed to build MPI-enable FFTW againt intel-parallel-studio
body:
I failed to build MPI-enable FFTW against Intel compiler and Intel MPI which are provided in intel-parallel-studio. FFTW configure process compilained MPI library not found.

### Expected Result

FFTW should be built with Intel compiler and Intel MPI library.

### Actual Result

Configuration fails  due to MPI library not found.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack spec fftw+mpi %intel@17.0.5 ^intel-parallel-studio
Input spec
--------------------------------
fftw%intel@17.0.5+mpi
    ^intel-parallel-studio

Normalized
--------------------------------
fftw%intel@17.0.5+mpi
    ^intel-parallel-studio

Concretized
--------------------------------
fftw@3.3.6-pl2%intel@17.0.5+double+float+long_double+mpi~openmp~pfft_patches~quad arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
    ^intel-parallel-studio@cluster.2017.5%intel@17.0.5+advisor+clck+daal~gdb~ilp64+inspector+ipp+itac+mkl+mpi~newdtags+rpath+shared+tbb threads=none +vtune arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
$ spack install fftw+mpi %intel@17.0.5 ^intel-parallel-studio
...
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '../configure' '--prefix=/lustre/spack/sandybridge/linux-centos7-x86_64/intel-17.0.5/fftw-3.3.6-pl2-i6nkeajjlb6o736hht6rtjoqsaeuwpky' '--enable-shared' '--enable-threads' '--enable-mpi' '--enable-sse2'

1 error found in build log:
     [ ... ]
     88    checking for mpcc_r... no
     89    checking for mpxlc... no
     90    checking for cmpicc... no
     91    checking for MPI_Init... no
     92    checking for MPI_Init in -lmpi... no
     93    checking for MPI_Init in -lmpich... no
  >> 94    configure: error: could not find mpi library for --enable-mpi
...
```
[spack-build.env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1491815/spack-build.env.txt)
[spack-build.out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1491816/spack-build.out.txt)

### Information on your system

I am using CentOS 7. `intel-parallel-studuio` is configured as an external package in `packages.yaml` installed somewhere else.
